title: How to Make Angel Biscuits

steps.headline: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Spray the foil with nonstick cooking spray.
Add yeast to warm water in a 2-cup glass measuring cup.
Let the yeast and water set for 10 minutes.
Add the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt to a large mixing bowl.
Cut the cold butter or margarine up into largish pieces.
Turn the mixer to low speed and cut the butter or margarine into the flour mixture.
Add the yeast and buttermilk to the flour mixture.
Knead to until the dough just holds together.
Cut biscuits out using a 2-inch biscuit cutter.
Place cut out biscuits on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

text: Preheat oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.  Spray the foil with nonstick cooking spray.  Add yeast to warm water in a 2-cup glass measuring cup.  Let the yeast and water set for 10 minutes.  Add the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt to a large mixing bowl.  Mix to combine.  Cut the cold butter or margarine up into largish pieces. Add to the flour mixture. Turn the mixer to low speed and cut the butter or margarine into the flour mixture.  Add the yeast and buttermilk to the flour mixture.  Knead to until the dough just holds together.  Pat dough out 3/4-inch thick.  Cut biscuits out using a 2-inch biscuit cutter.  Place cut out biscuits on the prepared baking sheet.  Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.
